response.name: Success (SAQ)

body.raw:
{
  "questionText": "Explain Newton's First Law of Motion and give an example from everyday life.",
  "questionType": "SAQ",
  "difficultyLevel": "ADVANCED",
  "marks": 10,
  "expectedTimeSeconds": 300,
  "modelAnswer": "Newton's First Law of Motion states that an object at rest stays at rest, and an object in motion stays in motion with the same speed and in the same direction unless acted upon by an external force. This is also known as the Law of Inertia. An everyday example is when a car stops suddenly and passengers continue to move forward - their bodies want to stay in motion until acted upon by an external force (like a seatbelt)."
}
